text: Lorandersonia baileyi (Bailey's rabbitbrush), is a North American species of flowering plants in the aster tribe within the sunflower family. It was initially discovered in the Guadalupe Mountains of New Mexico in 1902,Wooton, Elmer Ottis & Standley, Paul Carpenter 1913. Contributions from the United States National Herbarium 16(4): 181 as Chrysothamnus baileyi and has since been collected in Arizona, Utah, Colorado, Kansas, Oklahoma, Texas, Chihuahua, Coahuila, and Nuevo León.Biota of North America program 2014 county distribution map, Lorandersonia baileyi Lorandersonia baileyi is a branching shrub up to 70 cm (28 inches) tall. It has many small yellow flower heads, each with about 5 disc florets but no ray florets.Urbatsch, Lowell Edward, Roberts, Roland P., & Neubig, Kurt Maximilian 2005.
